basics.name: Darius DeSpain
basics.label: Software Engineer | Transitioning Servicemember | Active TS/SCI
basics.summary: Transitioning Servicemember who has a passion for solving technical problems. Seeking a Remote or Hybrid Full-Stack Software Engineer role in the Northern Colorado Region. Seeking full-time position start date of 28 October 2024. Active TS/SCI

work.summary: Internship through DoD SkillBridge program while I transition out of Active Duty. Area of focus during internship is software engineering to grow software development skills.
highlights: Tech stack: TypeScript/Node.js/React/NextJS/Java/Kotlin/SpringBoot/Keycloak/MySQL
Products: Tracer, Surefire
- Set up the entire acceptance testing environment using Playwright and a docker-compose file

- Implemented 5+ full-stack stories to add features to Tracer including create your system wizard, manage your workspace, upload a CSV exported from eMass, and a multi-layered table for viewing control hierarchy using MUI DataGrid Pro
- Assisted in reconfiguring and troubleshooting environment variable configuration for staging and multiple production environments, changing to injecting environment variables at run-time
- Converted over 10 JavaScript files to TypeScript to better catch errors on the UI

work.summary: Responsible for leading the software development team at Space Delta 8 (Del 8), designing and implementing software to enable the warfighters at Del 8, and assisting the CDT director in program management for Del 8's software portfolio.
highlights: Tech stack: TypeScript/NodeJS/React/Express/MongoDB & Couch DB
Products: MOR Tool, COMET

- Digitized operations requests with MOR tool, launching organization's first in-house software. Led 10 stakeholder meetings, wrote 5 key features, eliminating hard copies for approved requests resulting in being awarded Junior Officer of Q1/2023
- converted legacy full-stack application to low-code/no-code application on Warp Core, the USSF's instantiation of Palantir Foundry

work.summary: Full-Stack Developer assigned to the MOR Tool product team
highlights: Tech stack: TypeScript/NodeJS/React/Express/CouchDB
Products: MOR Tool
Big wins: Developed 2 major features for the MOR tool including a rich text editor and legacy PDF generator; enabled tool integration for 100 new users.

work.summary: Identified and coordinated preventative and reactive maintenance actions on 11 protected military communications satellites.
highlights: Led working-groups to trend satellite health and potential preventative actions
on-call engineering support for 4SOPS operators
Troubleshoot software, hardware and networking issues over the phone
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk
Assists with operations monitoring in the IT Operations Center

courses: Agile Software Development (Java with Extreme Programming)
Topics: Agile ceremonies, Roadmaps, Product Vision, OKRs/KPIs etc.
Topics: JavaScript, NodeJS, React, ExpressJS, PostgreSQL, Agile, TDD
Topics: Network Defense, Pen. Testing, Digital Forensics, Cryptography

volunteer.summary: Organization has STEM programs for K-12 students to create excitement and experience in the realm of technical problem solving
highlights: Mentor, FIRST Robotics Team 4068, Aug 2021 - Apr 2023
Mentor, FIRST Robotics Team 3008, Jun 2015 - Apr 2018
Various volunteer positions at local FIRST events

awards.title: AFROTC Type 1 Commander In-College Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to cadets who show the greatest officer potential and success in their academic career.

awards.title: Chancellor's Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship Awarded to incoming freshmen from Hawaii based upon high school GPA, test scores, and extra curricular activities.
